scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L is a star with 0.56 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 16960.11 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L system


OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L b

OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2020-04, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 3.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L b is 130.380 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L b is 14.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2017-BLG-0406L - System With 1 Exoplanet
